key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, will join the Global Citizen Live event in NYC on Sept. 25 for vaccine equity advocacy.
The event is part of a 24-hour global broadcast from Central Park aiming to promote global vaccine equity to combat COVID-19.
Global Citizen Live campaign calls on G7 countries and the EU to share 1 billion COVID-19 vaccine doses and waive vaccine intellectual property rights.
The campaign also urges Pfizer, BioNTech, and Moderna to share mRNA technology with the WHO-backed hub in South Africa.
Prince Harry and Meghan previously co-chaired the VAX LIVE event and wrote an open letter to Big Pharma about vaccine equity.
They led a fundraising effort for Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, raising $3.5 million for COVAX to distribute vaccines to low-income countries.
Prince Harry emphasized that access to the vaccine should be a basic right and not limited by geography.
The initiative addresses the ongoing issue of vaccine equity amid the spread of coronavirus variants and vaccine hoarding by rich countries.
The event will also feature appearances by health and global leaders, activists, and artists to promote environmental protection and poverty defeat.
It aims to pressure wealthy nations on climate change commitment, promote emissions reduction by businesses, and tackle global hunger with a $6 billion contribution.
